summary: Several fungal strains were isolated at the California Institute of Technology in Pasadena, CA . The study was published on August 11, 2013 .
The online version contains supplementary material available at 10.1186/s43008-023-00119-4 .

It has been shown that yeast and yeast-like fungi are capable of adapting to and colonizing various ecological niches due to their genetic and phenotypic plasticity and robustness . In this study, we describe for the first time two novel yeast species from NASA cleanrooms .

A block of agar was placed in the center of a sterile slide and inoculated with the yeast suspension . The slide culture was kept in a moist Petri dish lined with filter paper soaked in sterile water .

DNA was extracted from yeast cultures on PDA using tissue LEV purification kit . DNA was amplified using polymerase chain reaction (PCR) using primers ITS 1F (5′-CTT GGT CAT TTA GAG GAA GTA GTA A-3′) and Tw13 (5½-GGT CCG TGT TTC AAG ACG-3

Genes of length < 50aa and genes identified as transposable elements were filtered out of the dataset . tRNAscan-SE was used to predict tRNAs (Chan and Lowe) and funannotate annotate function was used . Biosynthetic gene clusters were predicted in the two yeast genomes via fungiSMASH .
Construction of phylogenetic trees utilizing the seven gene sequences listed above for MLSA was performed via IQ-TREE v 2.1.1 using the concatenation approach .
The evaluation of UV-C resistance was carried out via methods described previously (Blachowicz et al.  tree for each species was visualized with FigTree v 1.4.4 software .
PDA colonies on PDA are cream colored, round, and 30mm in diameter . Colonies are not observed to cluster or form pseudohyphae. Cells are round, vary widely in size, and reproduce through budding .
After 21 days of incubation at room temperature, colonies on PDA are bright orange, round, and 20mm in diameter . Individual yeast cells are ovoid in shape and observed to reproduce through budding .

LSU and ITS exhibited higher resolution in differentiating the Naganishia species . The novel species N. kalamii is most closely related to .albida . The tree based on conserved genes from the .em>Kalamii> FJI-L2-BK-P3T.T

GO annotated and 6007 Eggnog terms, 2548 Interpro and 4783 Pfam domains, 177 CAZYmes, 219 MEROPS peptidases, 396 secreted proteins, and 1624 BUSCO orthologs . N. kalamii has the highest number of genes (8085) and 7902 proteins products . Lowest numbers of CAZymes
The only strain exhibiting all the terms involved in UV resistance was Antarctic <em>N. vishniacii ANT03-052 strain .

All the seven loci investigated exhibited good resolution in delimiting the analysed <em>Cystobasidium species . Based on the MLSA tree, strain FKI-L6-BK-PAB1 constitutes a well-supported clade with each of the species representing well-separated lineage . Genome-wide comparison revealed that C. onofrii C. slooffiae secreted larger number of proteins . FKI-L6-BK-PAB1 T .T . FKI was second to

Heat shock protein 70 and other Pfam terms for predicted proteins involved in the dehydration stress-response are also commonly present in all the <em>Cystobasidium  species analyzed . UV radiation resistance protein (IPR018791) and short-coiled protein are present in the genome of the Antarctic <em >C. ongulense and in <em <

Among the three yeasts tested, only <em>N. onofrii exhibited higher resistance (~ 5.5 ×  #10<sup>3) resistance . 72% of conidia were cultivable after exposure to the highest dosage [3000 J/m <sup>2</sup>].

The case of the genus Naganishia is challenging as species were delimited based on very few substitutions in the two fragments, ITS and LSU . Based on the .albida clade of the . genus, the . clade is currently include three varieties of N. albida and three other
All the psychrophilic or psychrotolerant species exhibit the presence of cold-adapted genes which might have allowed them to colonize cold environments such as Antarctica and the deep sea .
Halophilic traits detected in the genomes of these species also likely contributes to their survival in the cleanroom environment . Yeasts are typically active in hyper-arid regions .

Deinococcal polysaccharide capsule (DeinoPol) has antioxidant properties involved in resistance to severe environmental stresses, including UV radiation and hydroxyl radicals . This adaptation is typically found in extremophiles .

The synthesis of extracellular enzymes which degrade organic matter and release nutrients is crucial for the survival of saprotrophs . We observed a loss in gene family (PFAM terms and GO-term counts) in both species, which is usually associated with a host/substrate shift from plants to animals

The function distna in the ape: Analyses of Phylogenetics and Evolution package (R software) with the Kimura 2-parameter substitution model was used for the generation of the matrix .
